contextId.information: Here the word "earthly" refers to that which characterizes human society that does not trust in God. AT: "not according to human wisdom" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here the word "heart" refers to the location of the emotions. AT: "with extreme sorrow" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Here the word "hearts" refers to the mind and thoughts. A spiritual veil covers their hearts, preventing them from being able to understand the old covenant. AT: "a veil lies over their minds" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: a veil lies over their hearts

contextId.information: Here the word "appearances" refers to outward expressions of things like ability and status. The word "heart" refers to the inward character of a person. AT: "those who boast about outward appearances ... not what a person is like on the inside" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: those who boast about appearances but not about what is in the heart

contextId.information: Here the word "world" refers to people in the world. AT: "in Christ, God is reconciling mankind to himself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: in Christ God is reconciling the world to himself

contextId.information: The word "flesh" is a metonym for sinful human nature. "we are acting from human motives" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: we are living according to the flesh

contextId.information: The word "flesh" is a metonym for physical life. AT: "we live our lives in physical bodies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Possible meanings are 1) the word "flesh" is a metonym for physical life. AT: "fight against our enemies using physical weapons" or 2) the word "flesh" is a metonym for sinful human nature. AT: "wage war in sinful ways" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: wage war according to the flesh

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) the word "fleshly" is a metonym for merely physical. AT: "are not physical" or 2) the word "fleshly" is a metonym for sinful human nature. AT: "are not sinful" or "do not enable us to do wrong" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The words "act of disobedience" are a metonym for the people who commit those acts. AT: "punish every one of you who disobey us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
